inlineContent.text: The app transforms physical paper documents into digital blueprints by performing optical character recognition (OCR), extracting structured information, and allowing users to interact with the content via an AI-powered chatbot.
Scan your paper Documents and have it in the App
Extracts text from scanned images and places it exactly at the correct position in a generated PDF.
Automatically identifies key information such as invoice numbers, amounts, dates, and salary details.
Splits unstructured or semi-structured texts into meaningful chunks for easier analysis.
Rebuilds tabular structures from scanned document fragments.
Enables natural language queries about document contents.
Uses machine learning models to create semantic embeddings and perform similarity comparisons.
A free API key for the GroqCloud
HuggingFace API key for embeddings and similarity search
These keys must be configured in a
Test on the iOS Simulator or a real device.
For first run on a device:
Connect iPhone via USB-C and trust developer account, on the device, in
Ensure device and Mac are on the same network for wireless debugging.

abstract.text: is an iOS app designed to scan, extract, and analyze documents such as invoices, contracts, payslips, and reports using advanced OCR and AI-based natural-language processing techniques.
A model representing an embedding vector associated with a unique identifier.
ViewModel responsible for managing and loading the content of a specific document file.
Represents any valid JSON value using an enum structure.
ViewModel responsible for parsing and managing data from a CSV file.
A view that provides a financial summary based on scanned document metadata.
Displays total invoice costs, latest net salary, and remaining income after expenses.
Handles all OCR-related operations including PDF and CSV generation.
A SwiftUI wrapper for
, allowing users to scan documents using the device camera.
The scanned image is passed back to the parent via bindings.
A model representing a single message in a chat interface.
Protocol defining a general interface for sending requests to an LLM (Large Language Model) client.
A view that displays a given
in full-screen mode with a black background.
Tapping the image will dismiss the view.
A simple splash screen that animates the logo and transitions to the main view.
Displays the app name and logo, then navigates to
after a short delay.
Represents a response format that requires the output to conform to a specific JSON schema.
This struct is used to specify the desired JSON schema for LLM responses.
A tile view that visually represents a document type with icon and label.
ViewModel responsible for managing the state of the document scanning process.
A utility struct for converting a 2D grid of strings into CSV format.
Singleton class responsible for managing chatbot communication using an LLM client.
Represents a segment of text extracted from a document.
Used when splitting long content into smaller, manageable pieces for processing.
Enum representing the different types of documents supported by scAIper.
Each case is codable, identifiable, and can be iterated over.
ViewModel responsible for managing documents inside a specific folder category.
Represents a single chat message for the LLM interaction, including its role and content.
A view showing all available document types in a grid.
Tapping on a document type navigates to the document scanner.
A namespace struct containing instructions, schema, and few-shot examples
for chunking unstructured or semi-structured document texts into logical sections.
Represents the chat response from the LLM, wrapping the choices with their messages.
A service that uses a large language model (LLM) to extract structured keywords from OCRed document text.
A SwiftUI wrapper for
using
This view displays a PDF document from a given file URL.
A view that displays the content of a selected document.
Supports PDF, CSV, and TXT file formats.
Request body for sentence similarity models.
Used to compute similarity between a source sentence and multiple candidate sentences.
Defines prompts and schemas for extracting keywords from documents using an LLM.
Service responsible for interacting with the LLM to structure document data (grid or image).
A lightweight 1D implementation of the DBSCAN clustering algorithm.
Defines models and prompts for reconstructing structured table data using LLMs.
A view that displays a list of document folders (categories) with navigation links to view their contents.
Users can delete entire categories or navigate into them to view documents.
Concrete implementation of the
for interacting with a language model API.
Request body for obtaining an embedding vector for a given input string.
Service that handles text chunking using an LLM (Large Language Model).
is an iOS app designed to scan, extract, and analyze documents such as invoices, contracts, payslips, and reports using advanced OCR and AI-based natural-language processing techniques.

logo.png.alt: An icon representing the scAIper framework.

abstract.text: Associates a document with a similarity score, e.g., from a vector search.
This is useful when ranking documents by relevance to a query.
A reusable view that displays a single chat message bubble, either from the user or the AI.
ViewModel responsible for handling OCR-related logic and animation state.
Represents the layout type of the document – plain text or tabular data.
Utility responsible for saving documents, organizing them by type, and initiating embedding generation.
A view allowing the user to save a scanned document by specifying its name and type.
Depending on the document type, keywords may be extracted using an LLM.
A view that displays the contents (files) of a specific document category folder.
Users can tap on documents to view their details or delete them from the list.
Central configuration struct holding API endpoints, model names, and API keys
for various AI services used throughout the app.
Manages persistent storage and retrieval of document metadata, including
saving, loading, and validating metadata files associated with scanned documents.
Represents a chat request payload sent to the LLM, parameterized by the response format type.
A view that allows users to initiate a document scan process for a specific document type.
Shows a visual scan area and opens the camera when tapped.
Represents the content of a chat message which can be a plain string or an array of content blocks.
ViewModel for managing document folder categories stored in the app’s document directory.
The main entry point for the scAIper application.
This struct initializes the app and sets the root view.
A view that displays the contents of a CSV file in a scrollable grid-like layout.
ViewModel responsible for managing chatbot messages and interactions with the chat service.
A simple loading indicator view that displays animated dots.
The number of dots cycles from 1 to 3 over time to simulate loading feedback.
A view that displays a simple chat interface where users can interact with the AI chatbot named scAIper.
A container for all prompt models and schemas used in the chatbot logic.
Represents a content block within a chat message, which can be either plain text or an image URL.
A model representing metadata for a processed document,
including its embedding, type, layout, content, and optional keywords.
ViewModel responsible for calculating and formatting financial data
based on the scanned document metadata.
A utility struct for clustering and analyzing grid-like data,
such as positions of elements in a document layout.
The main tab-based navigation view of the scAIper app.
Provides access to scanning, document management, financial analysis, and chatbot functionality.
Manages the core logic for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG),
including embedding computation, document similarity, and chunk retrieval.
